translation: (170) The Ninth Part of the Fundamental Distinct Chapter of the Parrot Sutra (Fourth Distinct)

source_sentence: 誦)
translation: to recite)

source_sentence: 我聞如是：一時，佛遊舍衛國，在勝林給孤獨園。
translation: Thus I have heard: One time, the Buddha was staying at Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta’s Grove in Sāvatthī.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊過夜平旦著衣持鉢，入舍衛乞食，於乞食時往詣鸚鵡摩納都提子家。
translation: It was then that the Bhagavān, wearing his robes and carrying his bowl at sunrise past midnight, entered Śrāvastī to solicit alms and went to the house of Pāṇḍu Manatṛṣṭiputra when he was begging.

source_sentence: 是時，鸚鵡摩納都提子少有所為，出行不在。
translation: At the time, the parrot Manadatta had little to do, so he didn't travel.

source_sentence: 彼時，鸚鵡摩納都提子家有白狗，在大床上金槃中食。
translation: At the time, there was a white dog at the house of Kanakamuni Māṇḍulī and he ate in a large gold pant on his bed.

source_sentence: 於是，白狗遙見佛來，見已便吠。
translation: Thereupon, the white dog saw the Buddha coming from a distance and barked after seeing him.

source_sentence: 世尊語白狗：「汝不應爾，謂汝從呧至吠。」
translation: The Bhagavān said to the white dog, You shouldn't do so, saying that you're coming from a hut to a bark.

source_sentence: 白狗聞已，極大瞋恚，從床來下，至木聚邊憂慼愁臥。
translation: On hearing this, the white dog became very angry and came down from its bed to lie cross-legged on the edge of a pile of wood.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡摩納都提子於後還家，見己白狗極大瞋恚，從床來下，至木聚邊憂慼愁臥，
translation: When the parrot Mānavatīputra returned home afterwards, he saw that his white dog became very angry. He came down from his couch and went to lie cross-legged at the edge of a mound of wood in sorrow.

source_sentence: 問家人曰：「誰觸嬈我狗，令極大瞋恚，從床來下，至木聚邊憂慼愁臥？」
translation: He asked the family members, Who touched my dog and made him become very angry, came down from his bed and went to sleep at the edge of a wood pile in sorrow?

source_sentence: 家人答曰：「我等都無觸嬈白狗，令大瞋恚，從床來下，至木聚邊憂慼愁臥。
translation: The monks replied, “None of us touched the white dogs and caused them to become very angry. They came down from their beds and went to sleep in distress at the edge of a pile of wooden bedding.

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 當知今日沙門瞿曇來此乞食，白狗見已，便逐吠之。
translation: You should know that today the śramaṇa Gautama has come here to solicit alms. On seeing him, the white dogs chase and bark at him.

source_sentence: 沙門瞿曇語白狗曰：『汝不應爾，謂汝從呧至吠。』
translation: The ascetic Gautama said to the white dog, 'That's not what you should say, which is that you go from Kauṇḍinya to Vaiśravaṇa.'

source_sentence: 因是，摩納！
translation: Because of this, Mānava!

source_sentence: 故令白狗極大瞋恚，從床來下，至木聚邊憂慼愁臥。」
translation: That's why the white dog became so angry that he came down from his bed and went to sleep cross-legged in sorrow at the edge of a wood pile.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡摩納都提子聞已，便大瞋恚，欲誣世尊，欲謗世尊，欲墮世尊。
translation: On hearing this, the parrot Mānavaruddha became greatly angry, wanting to misrepresent the Bhagavān, wanting to denigrate the Bhagavān, and wanting to fall into the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 如是誣、謗、墮沙門瞿曇，即從舍衛出，往詣勝林給孤獨園。
translation: Thus, the ascetic Gautama, who had misrepresented, denigrated, and fallen into error, left Sāvatthī and went to Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park in Jeta’s Grove.

source_sentence: 彼時，世尊無量大眾前後圍繞而為說法，世尊遙見鸚鵡摩納都提子來，
translation: At that time the World-honored One was teaching the Dharma, surrounded by an assembly of innumerable thousands of disciples. The World-honored One saw from a distance the arrival of the parrot Manasatya:

source_sentence: 告諸比丘：「汝等見鸚鵡摩納都提子來耶？」
translation: He told the monks, Do you see the arrival of the parrot Manatṛṣa?

source_sentence: 答曰：「見也。」
translation: He replied, I see it.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「鸚鵡摩納都提子今命終者，如屈伸臂頃，必生地獄。
translation: The Bhagavān told them, Now that the parrot Manattiya has died, he'll surely be born in hell as long as it takes to bend and stretch out his arm.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 以彼於我極大瞋恚。
translation: It's because they're extremely angry with me.

source_sentence: 若有眾生因心瞋恚故，身壞命終，必至惡處，生地獄中。」
translation: If there are sentient beings who become angry because of their anger, they'll surely go to a bad place and be born in hell when their bodies break up and their lives end.

source_sentence: 於是，鸚鵡摩納都提子往詣佛所，語世尊曰：「沙門瞿曇！
translation: Thereupon, the parrot Mānavatīputra went to the Buddha and said to the Bhagavān, Ascetic Gautama!

source_sentence: 今至我家乞食來耶？」
translation: Have you come to my house now to solicit alms?

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「我今往至汝家乞食。」
translation: The Bhagavān answered, Now, I'll go to your house to solicit alms.

source_sentence: 「瞿曇！
translation: “Gautama!

source_sentence: 向我白狗說何等事，令我白狗極大瞋恚，從床來下，至木聚邊憂慼愁臥？」
translation: What did you say to my white dog that caused my white dog to become so angry that he came down from his bed and went to sleep sadly at the edge of a cluster of wood?

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「我今平旦著衣持鉢，入舍衛乞食，展轉往詣汝家乞食，於是白狗遙見我來，
translation: The World-honored One replied: At dawn this morning I put on my robes, took my bowl, and entered Sāvatthī to solicit alms. Then the white dog saw me coming from a distance.

source_sentence: 見已而吠。
translation: After seeing it, he barked.

source_sentence: 我語白狗：『汝不應爾，謂汝從呧至吠。』
translation: I said to the white dog, 'You shouldn't do so; I'll tell you to go from the stable to the bark.'

source_sentence: 是故白狗極大瞋恚，從床來下，至木聚邊憂慼愁臥。」
translation: That's why the white dog became so angry that he came down from his bed and went to sleep cross-legged in sorrow at the edge of a wood pile.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡摩納問世尊曰：「白狗前世是我何等？」
translation: The parrot Māna asked the Bhagavān, What was I in the past life of the white dog?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「止！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Don't!

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 慎莫問我，汝聞此已，必不可意。」
translation: Don't ask me questions; after hearing this, you won't want to do so.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡摩納復更再三問世尊曰：「白狗前世是我何等？」
translation: Again and again, the parrot Māna asked the Bhagavān three times, What was I in the past life of the white dog?

source_sentence: 世尊亦至再三告曰：「止！
translation: The Bhagavān also arrived and repeatedly told him, Stop!

source_sentence: 止！
translation: Don't!

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 慎莫問我，汝聞此已，必不可意。」
translation: Don't ask me questions; after hearing this, you won't want to do so.

source_sentence: 世尊復告於摩納曰：「汝至再三問我不止，摩納！
translation: Again, the Bhagavān addressed Mānava, saying, You've asked me repeatedly and repeatedly without stopping, Mānava!

source_sentence: 當知彼白狗者，於前世時即是汝父，名都提也。」
translation: You should know that white dog was your father in a previous life, named Tuṣita.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡摩納聞是語已，倍極大恚，欲誣世尊，欲謗世尊，欲墮世尊。
translation: After hearing these words, the parrot Mānava became doubly angry, wanting to misrepresent the Bhagavān, wanting to denigrate the Bhagavān, and wanting to fall into the Bhagavān.

source_sentence: 如是誣、謗、墮沙門瞿曇，語世尊曰：「我父都提大行布施，作大齋祠，
translation: Thus, the ascetic Gautama, who had misrepresented, slandered, and disparaged him, said to the Bhagavān, “My father, Duṣprasāha, made a great offering of almsfood and offered a great sacrifice.

source_sentence: 身壞命終，正生梵天。
translation: When his body breaks up and his life ends, he's rightly born in the Brahma Heaven.

source_sentence: 何因何緣，乃生於此下賤狗中？」
translation: What is the cause and condition for being born among these inferior dogs?

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「汝父都提以此增上慢，是故生於下賤狗中。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Your father, Duti, is so arrogant that he's born among inferior dogs.

source_sentence: 「梵志增上慢，　　此終六處生，
translation: “The brahmin is overweeningly arrogant. At the end of his life he will be reborn in one of the six heavens,

source_sentence: 雞狗猪及犲，　　驢五地獄六。
translation: chickens, dogs, pigs, hogs, mules, and the five hells.

source_sentence: 「鸚鵡摩納！
translation: Parrot Manas!

source_sentence: 若汝不信我所說者，汝可還歸語白狗曰：『若前世時是我父者，白狗當還在大床上。』
translation: If you don't believe what I teach, you can return and say to the white dog, 'If this was my father in a previous life, the white dog would still be on his large bed.'

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 白狗必還上床也。
translation: The white dog will surely return to the bed.

source_sentence: 『若前世時是我父者，白狗還於金槃中食。』
translation: 'If it was my father in a previous life, the white dog would have returned to eat in the gold pan.'

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 白狗必當還於金槃中食也。
translation: The white dog will surely return to eat in the golden palace.

source_sentence: 『若前世時是我父者，示我所舉金、銀、水精、珍寶藏處，謂我所不知。』
translation: 'If this was my father in a previous life, he showed me the storehouse of gold, silver, crystal, and precious treasures that I didn't know.'

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 白狗必當示汝已前所舉金、銀、水精、珍寶藏處，謂汝所不知。」
translation: The white dog will surely show you the storehouse of gold, silver, crystal, and precious treasures that you've already mentioned, meaning you don't know them.

source_sentence: 於是，鸚鵡摩納聞佛所說，善受持誦，繞世尊已，而還其家，語白狗曰：「若前世時是我父者，
translation: Then the parrot Mānava, having heard what the Buddha preached, remembered it well. Having circumambulated the World-honored One, he returned home and said to the dog, “If this was my father in a previous existence,

source_sentence: 白狗當還在大床上。」
translation: The white dog will still be on the big bed.

source_sentence: 白狗即還在大床上。
translation: The white dog then remained on the big bed.

source_sentence: 「若前世時是我父者，白狗還於金槃中食。」
translation: If it was my father in a previous life, the white dog would have returned to eat in the gold pan.

source_sentence: 白狗即還金槃中食。
translation: The white dog then returned to the gold-pan and ate.

source_sentence: 「若前世時是我父者，當示於我父本所舉金、銀、水精、珍寶藏處，謂我所不知。」
translation: If someone was my father in a previous life, they'll show me the gold, silver, crystal, and treasured storehouses that my father originally held, saying I didn't know them.

source_sentence: 白狗即從床上來下，往至前世所止宿處，以口及足掊床四脚下，鸚鵡摩納便從彼處大得寶物。
translation: The white dog then came down from the bed and went to the place where he had stayed in the previous life, put his mouth and feet under the four feet of the couch, and the parrot-and-monkey Māna then obtained a large amount of treasures from that place.

source_sentence: 於是，鸚鵡摩納都提子得寶物已，極大歡喜，以右膝著地，叉手向勝林給孤獨園，
translation: Then the parrot Mānavatīputra, having obtained the treasures, was greatly delighted. He knelt on the ground with his right knee joined [to the ground], saluted the Buddha by placing his palms together in the superior forest and offered them to Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

source_sentence: 再三舉聲，稱譽世尊：「沙門瞿曇所說不虛，沙門瞿曇所說真諦，沙門瞿曇所說如實。」
translation: He repeatedly raised his voice and praised the Bhagavān, saying, What the ascetic Gautama teaches is not false, what the ascetic Gautama teaches is true, and what the ascetic Gautama teaches is true.

source_sentence: 再三稱譽已，從舍衛出，往詣勝林給孤獨園。
translation: After repeating his praise three times, he left Śrāvastī and went to the Anāthapiṇḍada Park in Jeta’s Grove.

source_sentence: 爾時，世尊無量大眾前後圍繞而為說法，世尊遙見鸚鵡摩納來，告諸比丘：「汝等見鸚鵡摩納來耶？」
translation: At the time, the Bhagavān was teaching the Dharma to an immeasurable number of people in front and behind him, and the Bhagavān saw Pāṇḍu Mana coming from a distance and told the monks, Do you see Pāṇḍu Mana coming?

source_sentence: 答曰：「見也。」
translation: He replied, I see it.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「鸚鵡摩納今命終者，如屈伸臂頃，必至善處。
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Now that the parrot Manas has died, he'll surely go to a good place as long as it takes to bend and stretch out his arm.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 彼於我極有善心。
translation: They have a very good mind for me.

source_sentence: 若有眾生因善心故，身壞命終，必至善處，生於天中。」
translation: If there are sentient beings whose bodies break up at the end of life because of good thoughts, they'll surely go to a good place and be born in heaven.

source_sentence: 爾時，鸚鵡摩納往詣佛所，共相問訊，却坐一面，世尊告曰：「云何摩納？
translation: At that time the parrot Mānava approached the Buddha. They greeted each other and withdrew to sit at one side. The World-honored One said:

source_sentence: 如我所說白狗者為如是耶？
translation: Is the white dog that I've described as white is like this?

source_sentence: 不如是耶？」
translation: Is it not like this?

source_sentence: 鸚鵡摩納白曰：「瞿曇！
translation: The parrot Mānava said, Gautama!

source_sentence: 實如所說。
translation: It's really as explained.

source_sentence: 瞿曇！
translation: “O Gautama!

source_sentence: 我復欲有所問，聽乃敢陳。」
translation: Again, I want to ask a question, so I'll listen and dare to say it.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「恣汝所問。」
translation: The Bhagavān told him, As long as you ask questions.

source_sentence: 「瞿曇！
translation: “Gautama!

source_sentence: 何因何緣，彼眾生者，俱受人身而有高下、有妙不妙？
translation: What's the cause and condition that those sentient beings are both subject to a person's body, whether it's high or low, marvelous or not marvelous?

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 瞿曇！
translation: “O Gautama!

source_sentence: 我見有短壽、有長壽者，見有多病、有少病者，見不端正、有端正者，
translation: I see those with short life spans and those with long life spans. I see those with many illnesses and those with few illnesses.

source_sentence: 見無威德、有威德者，見有卑賤族、有尊貴族者，見無財物、有財物者，
translation: They see those who lack mighty virtue and those who have mighty virtue, those who are of lowly castes and those of noble castes, and those without property and possessing property.

source_sentence: 見有惡智、有善智者。」
translation: Seeing someone with bad cognition and someone with good cognition.

source_sentence: 世尊答曰：「彼眾生者，因自行業，因業得報，緣業、依業、業處，眾生隨其高下處妙不妙。」
translation: The Bhagavān answered, Those sentient beings are the result of their own actions, the results of actions, the conditions for actions, the bases of actions, and the locations of actions, and sentient beings follow them as high and low places that are marvelous and not marvelous.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡摩納白世尊曰：「沙門瞿曇所說至略，不廣分別，我不能知，願沙門瞿曇為我廣說，
translation: The parrot Mānava said to the World-honored One, “The exhortation of the renunciant Gotama is so brief that I cannot give a detailed explanation. May the renunciant Gotama give me a detailed explanation?

source_sentence: 令得知義。」
translation: I'll let you know the meaning.

source_sentence: 世尊告曰：「摩納！
translation: The Bhagavān told him, Mānava!

source_sentence: 諦聽，善思念之，我當為汝廣分別說。」
translation: Listen closely, and well consider it; I will explain it in detail for you.

source_sentence: 鸚鵡摩納白曰：「唯然。
translation: The parrot Mānava said, Yes.

source_sentence: 當受教聽。」
translation: You will be taught and listened to.

source_sentence: 佛言：「摩納！
translation: The Buddha said, Mānava!

source_sentence: 何因、何緣男子女人壽命極短？
translation: What is the cause and what is the condition for a man’s and woman’s extremely short life span?

source_sentence: 若有男子女人殺生凶弊，極惡飲血，害意著惡，無有慈心於諸眾生乃至蜫蟲，
translation: Suppose there is a man or woman who kills sentient beings with ferocious violence, drinks excessively and badly, harming others with malicious intent and clinging to evil. He or she does not have compassion for sentient beings, even the smallest of them, such as gnats and insects.

source_sentence: 彼受此業，作具足已，身壞命終，必至惡處，生地獄中，來生人間，壽命極短。
translation: After receiving this action, they'll be replete with it, and when their body breaks up and their life ends, they'll surely go to a bad place, be born in hell, come to be born among humans, and have an extremely short life span.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此道受短壽，謂男子女人殺生凶弊，極惡飲血。
translation: This path is subject to a short life span, meaning that men and women commit killing, which is terrifying and extremely bad like drinking blood.

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 當知此業有如是報也。
translation: You should know that this action has such a reward.

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 何因、何緣男子女人壽命極長？
translation: What is the reason and what is the condition for the great longevity of men and women?

source_sentence: 若有男子女人離殺斷殺，棄捨刀杖，有慙有愧，有慈悲心，饒益一切乃至蜫蟲，
translation: Suppose there are men and women who abstain from killing, abandon killing, discard their swords and sticks, have shame and shame, and have kindness and compassion that benefits all living beings, even insects and worms.

source_sentence: 彼受此業，作具足已，身壞命終，必昇善處，生於天中，來生人間，壽命極長。
translation: After receiving this action, they'll be replete with it, and when their body breaks up and their life ends, they'll surely ascend to a good place, be born among gods, come to be born among humans, and have an extremely long life span.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此道受長壽，謂男子女人離殺斷殺。
translation: This path receives a long life span, meaning that men and women abstain from killing and stop killing.

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 當知此業有如是報也。
translation: You should know that this action has such a reward.

source_sentence: 「摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 何因、何緣男子女人多有疾病？
translation: What are the causes and conditions that often cause illness in men and women?

source_sentence: 若有男子女人觸嬈眾生，彼或以手拳，或以木石，或以刀杖觸嬈眾生，
translation: If a man or woman touches and disturbs sentient beings, they may touch them with their hands, fists, wooden stones, or swords and staves.

source_sentence: 彼受此業，作具足已，身壞命終，必至惡處，生地獄中，來生人間，多有疾病。
translation: After receiving this action, they'll be replete with it, and when their body breaks up and their life ends, they'll surely go to a bad place, be born in hell, come to be born among humans, and often suffer from illness.

source_sentence: 所以者何？
translation: Why is that?

source_sentence: 此道受多疾病，謂男子女人觸嬈眾生。
translation: This path is subject to many illnesses, meaning that men and women touch sentient beings.

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 當知此業有如是報也。
translation: You should know that this action has such a reward.

source_sentence: 摩納！
translation: Mānava!

source_sentence: 何因、何緣男子女人無有疾病？
translation: What's the cause and what's the condition that men and women aren't sick?
